sense.name: an exercise area where baseball pitchers warm up
sense.examples: There is still no action in the Yankee bullpen. Jones and Johnson are both warming up in the bullpen. Now Davis gets up and walks towards the bullpen.

sense.name: a detention center for prisoners or refugees
sense.examples: They are holding these insurgents in an undisclosed bullpen. There are too many refugees to manage in one bullpen.

sense.name: the relief pitchers of a baseball team
sense.examples: He's a young hurler who joined the Sox bullpen last season. They've added two left handed pitchers to the bullpen this year.

sense.name: an open work area shared by employees, often in publishing
sense.examples: The junior editors all work in a bullpen at the publishing house. The employees tend to interact more in the bullpen than in private offices.
